articles.title: Brain molecule may make us recall memories as being good or bad

articles.title: China prepares to launch laboratory module to Tiangong space station
articles.description: On 24 July, China will launch the second of three modules to its space station, with the rocket taking off from Hainan island, located south of Hong Kong, at around 2am local time

articles.title: Doctors are concerned about the risk of hospital-acquired covid-19
articles.description: People who go to hospital for non-covid treatment are at higher risk of the virus compared with the general public, which is why high levels of hospital-acquired covid-19 in England are worrying some doctors

articles.title: Beware the rise of corporate rituals designed to manipulate employees
articles.description: Companies are increasingly looking to engender loyalty by tapping into our evolved need to belong. But the emotional costs of bonding sessions and other techniques can be high and the sense of belonging false, warns Jonathan R Goodman

articles.title: Coronavirus may enter the brain by building tiny tunnels from the nose
articles.description: How the virus behind covid-19 enters the brain was somewhat of a mystery, but new evidence hints it may build tiny tubes from nose cells to brain cells that it can shuttle through
articles.content:
By Alice Klein
The coronavirus may build tubes that enable it to travel from nose cells to the brain

articles.title: Coronavirus in late pregnancy raises premature birth risk seven-fold
articles.description: Testing positive for the coronavirus in the last three months of pregnancy may double the risk of a premature birth, rising to a seven-fold increased risk if infected after 34 weeks
